result.execSummary:
The defendant Douglas A Bonnett was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superAgency.name: Washington County
superAgency.notes: Defendant shall comply with conditions of Deferred Prosecution Agreement.

supervisions.notes: With Huber privileges consistent with the rules of the jail while the inmate maintains a minimum security status. The defendant, at the discretion of the Sheriff, may perform community service work as an inmate worker in the county jail and shall earn statutory good time for same.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or will discharge with outstanding financial obligations due, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due.

Defendant shall not consume alcohol.

Defendant shall have no violent contact with the victim - Julie Thurner.

Defendant shall participate in all counseling, assessments and/or treatment programs directed by the probation agent.

Defendant shall provide DNA sample.

Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Douglas A Bonnett

Def in person & by Atty Catherine Jane Terry.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Motion for immediate sentence due to def violating terms of DPA.  Def admits to violating DPA.  Court finds def has violated terms of DPA and finds def guilty.  Argument from State and counsel.  Court proceeds to sentencing.  DPAH set 6-8-16 at 1:15pm removed from calendar.

Def in person & by Atty Catherine Jane Terry.  Atty Stephanie L Hanson appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Agreement reached w/deferred prosecution agreement recommended.  Def enters guilty plea.  Court accepts plea, withholds finding of guilt, and approves deferred prosecution agreement.  Jury trial set 7-27-15 removed from calendar.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

Def in person & by Atty Catherine Jane Terry.  Atty Peter John Cannon appeared for State.  Clerk: CP.  Victim present in Court.  Def requests bond modification.  Court questions victim.  Court modifies conditions of bond removing no contact w/address provision and changing contact w/victim to no violent contact.  Offer has been rec'd, however, counsel enters not guilty plea and req trial be set.    The Court orders all motions, including motions in limine,  be filed on or before the jury status date.  Jury trial scheduled for July 27, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for June 10, 2015 at 02:45 pm.

Def appeared in person.  Atty Sandra Jo Giernoth for State.  Clerk: CP.    Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Court sets $650 cash bond, previously posted.  Def to retain private counsel.    Adjourned to allow defendant to appear with an attorney.  Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 02:45 pm.
